heisig_chinese_memo: All those hungry models in Hollywood - they want to eat, but their ego makes sure they grin and bear it!
heisig_constituent: starve, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, ego, hand, fiesta
koohiiStory1: All those starving models in Hollywood - they want to eat, but their ego (about their appearance and trim look) makes sure they grin and bear it!
koohiiStory2: He starves for FOOD but his EGO won´t let him beg.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you have nothing to eat but your ego, you'll starve. You can't eat it, and your ego is keeping you from accepting actual food or help from other people.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You have to check your ego at the door, because you'll definitely starve otherwise.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You starve (thanks ego) and turn into a gargoyle (が). As your stomach aches, your skin turns gray and you slowly harden into a crouched position.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now your starved body has been moved to the top of a castle, where you scare away people and birds with your loud grumbling stomach and scary face.
Ru_Radicals: 亅 (зазубрина), 戈 (копьё), 手 (рука), 食 (еда)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: I myself (我) eat (飠) if I'm starving
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The miser is always begging for food because he is hungry.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " food " to " me " sound. The original meaning is hunger. "Said Wen": "Hungry, hungry. From food, my voice." "Guang Yun. "Xie Yun": "Hungry, not full." Such as "The Analects. "Ji Family": "Bo Yi and Shu Qi are hungry under the first sun, and the people come to call it today." "Zhuangzi. "Dasheng": "There are single leopards in Lu, who live on rocks and drink water, and do not benefit the people. They are 70 years old and still look like babies. Unfortunately, when they encounter hungry tigers, they kill and eat them." "Zhou Yi Jing Zhuan. The ninth line of Ersanziwen: "If you can't support your mouth, you can't eat when you are hungry, it's called "㓝(刑)屋(馬)").

" Hungry " and " hungry " have different degrees in ancient Chinese. " Hungry " is simply not having enough to eat, while " hungry " is a serious " hunger " and even threat of death. "Zhengzitong. Food Department: "Hungry, very hungry." Such as "Han Feizi. "Decoration of Evil": "Family has permanent career, although hungry is not hungry; State-owned common law, although perilous." "Historical Records. "The Family of Zhao": "The master father wanted to get out, and he couldn't eat, so he ate him when he visited the king, and starved to death in Dune Palace for more than three months."
humanum_short_description_en: From " food " to " me " sound. The original meaning is hunger.
humanum_full_description:
從「食」，「我」聲。本義是飢餓。《說文》：「餓，飢也。从食，我聲。」《廣韻．箇韻》：「餓，不飽也。」如《論語．季氏》：「伯夷、叔齊餓于首陽之下，民到于今稱之。」《莊子．達生》：「魯有單豹者，巖居而水飲，不與民共利，行年七十而猶有嬰兒之色；不幸遇餓虎，餓虎殺而食之。」馬王堆帛書《周易經傳．二三子問》第9行：「口養不至，飢餓不得食，謂『㓝（刑）屋（渥）』。」

　　「飢」和「餓」在古漢語有程度上的不同。「飢」只是吃不飽，而「餓」則是嚴重的「飢」，甚至有死亡的威脅。《正字通．食部》：「餓，飢甚。」如《韓非子．飾邪》：「家有常業，雖飢不餓；國有常法，雖危不亡。」《史記．趙世家》：「主父欲出不得，又不得食，探爵鷇而食之，三月餘而餓死沙丘宮。」

從「 食 」，「 我 」聲。本義是飢餓。《說文》：「餓，飢也。从食，我聲。」《廣韻．箇韻》：「餓，不飽也。」如《論語．季氏》：「伯夷、叔齊餓于首陽之下，民到于今稱之。」《莊子．達生》：「魯有單豹者，巖居而水飲，不與民共利，行年七十而猶有嬰兒之色；不幸遇餓虎，餓虎殺而食之。」馬王堆帛書《周易經傳．二三子問》第9行：「口養不至，飢餓不得食，謂『㓝（刑）屋（渥）』。」 「 飢 」和「 餓 」在古漢語有程度上的不同。「 飢 」只是吃不飽，而「 餓 」則是嚴重的「 飢 」，甚至有死亡的威脅。《正字通．食部》：「餓，飢甚。」如《韓非子．飾邪》：「家有常業，雖飢不餓；國有常法，雖危不亡。」《史記．趙世家》：「主父欲出不得，又不得食，探爵鷇而食之，三月餘而餓死沙丘宮。」

Unfortunately, when they encounter hungry tigers, they kill and eat them." "Zhou Yi Jing Zhuan. The ninth line of Ersanziwen: "If you can't support your mouth, you can't eat when you are hungry, it's called "㓝(刑)屋(馬)"). " Hungry" and " hungry" have different degrees in ancient Chinese. " Hungry" is simply not having enough to eat, while " hungry" is a serious " hunger" and even threat of death. "Zhengzitong. Food Department: "Hungry, very hungry." Such as "Han Feizi. 餓字的基本解释

餓
è
见“饿”。

餓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［è］
［《廣韻》五个切，去箇，疑。］
“饿1”的繁体字。
(1)飢之甚；不饱。
(2)特指饿死。
(3)使受饿。
(4)指饥荒。

餓字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【食字部】　餓； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1420第08
【唐韻】【正韻】五箇切【集韻】【韻會】牛箇切，?我去聲。【玉篇】飢也。【廣韻】不飽也。【禮·檀弓】昔者衞國凶飢，夫子爲粥，與國之餓者。◎按韓子飾邪篇：家有常業，雖飢不餓。淮南子說山訓：寧一月飢，毋一旬餓。以此推之，餓甚于飢也。故孟子朝不食，夕不食，兼飢餓言。

è
вм. 饿
Radicals: 食, 我  (eat, ego)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you have nothing to eat but your ego, you'll starve. You can't eat it, and your ego is keeping you from accepting actual food or help from other people.
You have to check your ego at the door, because you'll definitely starve otherwise.
Reading Mnemonic
You starve (thanks ego) and turn into a gargoyle (が). As your stomach aches, your skin turns gray and you slowly harden into a crouched position.
Now your starved body has been moved to the top of a castle, where you scare away people and birds with your loud grumbling stomach and scary face.
